message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lab results indicate severe neutropenia, which is a known side effect of clozapine. Clozapine has been shown to have improved efficacy in treating refractory schizophrenia and requires frequent follow-up visits due to the risk of agranulocytosis.

The patient's symptoms suggest a psychotic disorder, and the drug prescribed has improved efficacy in treating his disorder but requires frequent follow-up visits, indicating Clozapine. The lab results indicate a decreased white blood cell count, which is a known adverse effect of Clozapine therapy. Haloperidol and Chlorpromazine are both typical antipsychotics, while Lurasidone is an atypical antipsychotic, but none of them are known to cause the same adverse effect as Clozapine.
